# renderingAPI

**Instance Property**

The graphics technology SceneKit uses to render the scene.

## Declaration

```swift
var renderingAPI: SCNRenderingAPI { get }
```

## Discussion

You choose a graphics technology when initializing a scene renderer:

- When initializing a [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView] object, use the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView/init(frame:options:)] initializer and the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView/Option/preferredRenderingAPI] key. Alternatively, create a view in Interface Builder and use the Rendering API control in the inspector. During initialization, the view will attempt to use the preferred API, but will fall back to a different API if the preferred one is not supported on the current hardware.
- To create a [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNRenderer] object that renders into your own OpenGL contect, use the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNRenderer/init(context:options:)] initializer. To create a renderer for use in your own Metal workflow, use the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNRenderer/init(device:options:)] initializer.
- The rendering technology used by a [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLayer] object is determined by Core Animation.

After initializing a renderer, this property reflects the rendering technology in use.

## Managing Scene Display

- **pointOfView**: The node from which the scene’s contents are viewed for rendering.
- **autoenablesDefaultLighting**: A Boolean value that determines whether SceneKit automatically adds lights to a scene.
- **isJitteringEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether SceneKit applies jittering to reduce aliasing artifacts.
- **showsStatistics**: A Boolean value that determines whether SceneKit displays rendering performance statistics in an accessory view.
- **debugOptions**: Options for drawing overlay content in a scene that can aid debugging.
- **SCNDebugOptions**: Options for drawing overlays with SceneKit content that can aid in debugging, used with the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneRenderer/debugOptions] property.
- **SCNRenderingAPI**: Options for choosing the graphics technology for an [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView] object (or other SceneKit renderer) to use for drawing its contents. Used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneRenderer/renderingAPI] property and the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView/Option/preferredRenderingAPI] option when initializing an [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView] object.
